STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 26, 2023
Chad Ulferts
Wayne County DHHS- Western
27540 Michigan Ave.
Inkster, MI, 48141-2202
RE: License#: CP820201497
Dear Mr. Ulferts:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 10/18/2023. An Exit conference was held with your agency on 10/20/2023. Due to the
violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3317
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP820201497
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius LuJuan Starling
Chief Administrator: Chad Ulferts
Name of Agency: Wayne County DHHS - Western
Agency Address: 27540 Michigan Ave.
Inkster, MI 48141-2202
Agency Telephone #: 313-295-8017
Original Issuance Date: 05/01/1992
License Status Regular
License Effective Date 11/24/2021
License Expiration Date 11/23/2023
Service Types: Certify foster homes for license, Supervise
Independent Living, Place children in foster
home

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy must,
include all the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(i) A comprehensive medical examination, including a
behavioral/mental health and trauma screening, within
30 calendar days from the date the child entered into
an out-of-home placement, regardless of the date of
the last physical examination.
Four of eight open foster child records reviewed showed the child's trauma
screening was not completed timely per the rule:
• One child's trauma screening was due by 4/7/2023 and completed late on
9/5/2023.
• A second child's trauma screening was due by 4/27/2023 and completed
late on 6/1/2023.
• A third child's trauma screening was due by 6/22/2023 and completed late
on 10/11/2023.
• A fourth child's trauma screening was due by 9/14/2022 and completed
late on 6/16/2023.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2022 Interim inspection, cited under FOM
802, with a CAP approved on 11/9/2022.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans.

(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of 18 updated service plans reviewed was not completed timely. The child's
3/29/2023-6/26/2023 USP was completed over two months late on 9/19/2023.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2021 Renewal inspection, with a CAP
approved on 10/19/2021.
CPA Rule 400.12420 Updated service plans.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R
400.12418(2)(b), must include all the following
information:
(g) A child behavior support plan that includes any
changes made since the previous plan and is to be
used by the foster parents.
Three of 18 updated service plans reviewed (related to two of eight open foster
child records reviewed) did not show documentation of a specific behavior
support plan for the child.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2021 Renewal inspection, with a CAP
approved on 10/19/2021.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact.
(2) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster
child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in the child's
placement at least once every month.
One of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show documentation of an
April 2023 home visit with the child and caregiver.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact.
(4) An agency shall facilitate in-person contact between
siblings who are not placed together except when there
is a court determination that contact is detrimental to
either child.

In one of eight open foster child records reviewed, where the child was placed
separately from their siblings, the record did not show documentation of a June,
July, August or September 2023 sibling visit.
FOM 722-6B Family Team Meeting.
Each meeting must be documented in MiSACWIS
using the FTM hyperlink and all of the appropriate
forms must be completed for each type of meeting.
Certain circumstances, events, and/or stages of case
progression mandate FTMs must occur within the
required time frames as out lined in the following table:
Case Plan Development/ Reassessment
Initial Case Plan (ISP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date. Note: This FTM may be
combined with the CPS Case Opening (ISP) FTM.
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date. Permanent Ward
Service Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date.
Semi-Annual Transition Meeting
Within 30 calendar days after the child’s 14th birthday
and every six months thereafter
Three of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show compliance:
• One record did not show documentation of an a FTM for the child’s
5/26/2023-8/23/2023 USP.
• A second record did not show documentation of an FTM for the child’s
1/28/2023-4/26/2023 and 4/27/2023-7/23/2023 respective USP. An FTM
was completed on 6/13/2023, which was not within the required time
frame for either USP.
• A third record showed a required semi-annual transitional meeting for the
child, due by 7/27/2023 was completed late on 10/10/2023.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2022 Interim inspection, with a CAP
approved on 11/9/2022; and the 2021 Renewal inspection, with a CAP
approved on 10/19/2021.
FOM 722-6B Family Team Meeting.
Post Family Team Meeting:
Following the FTM, the caseworker is responsible for
the following: • Completing the DHS-1105, Family

Team Meeting Report, checking it for accuracy,
identifying areas needing follow-up, and recording the
outcome data.
Two of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show compliance:
• One record did not show documentation of a DHS-1105 for an FTM
indicated on 4/25/2023.
• A second record did not show documentation of a DHS-1105 for an FTM
indicated on 6/13/2023.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2022 Interim inspection, with a CAP
approved on 11/9/2022; and the 2021 Renewal inspection, with a CAP
approved on 10/19/2021.
FOM 722-8D Treatment Plan.
Agreement and signature:
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
• Caseworker.
• Supervisor.
• Parents who are a member of a participating
household.
• Youth ages 14 and older
• Foster parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated
court ordered caregivers.
The caseworker must obtain signatures from all
applicable individuals and upload the signatures pages
into the electronic case record within 30 days of the
report date.
Seven of 22 service plans reviewed (related to four of eight open foster child records
reviewed) did not show compliance:
• One child’s 2/25/2023-5/25/2023 treatment plan for the child’s USP was not
signed by the foster care worker, foster care supervisor or birth parents. This
same child’s 5/26/2023-8/23/2023 treatment plan was not signed by the birth
parents.
• A second child’s 3/27/2023-4/25/2023 treatment plan for the child’s ISP was
not signed by the caregiver. This child’s next treatment plan for the
4/26/2023-7/11/2023 USP was not signed by the caregiver; and the agency
obtained the birth parent’s signature for this treatment plan after the required
timeframe, on 10/19/2023.
• A third child’s 10/19/2022-1/13/2023 treatment plan for the child’s USP was
not signed by the foster care worker or supervisor. This treatment plan was

not signed the youth until 3/21/2023; and the birth parent until 3/23/2023.
This child’s next treatment plan for the 1/14/2023-4/12/2023 USP was not
signed by the youth.
• A fourth child’s 4/29/2023-7/27/2023 treatment plan for the child’s USP was
not signed by the birth parent. It was not signed by caregiver until
10/18/2023.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2022 Interim inspection, with a CAP
approved on 11/9/2022; and the 2021 Renewal inspection, cited under FOM
722-8C, with a CAP approved on 10/19/2021.
FOM 801-C Medical Passport.
Initial medical passport:
For children entering foster care, the initial medical
passport must be provided within two weeks of the child's
placement date to the following.
All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information
Two of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show compliance:
• One child’s record did not show documentation that the caregiver was
provided a copy of the child’s medical passport within two weeks of the
child’s placement. This same record did not show documentation of an
updated medical passport.
• A second child’s record did not show documentation of a current medical
passport showing documentation of the child’s 5/30/2023 medical exam and
5/22/2023 dental exam.
• A third child’s record did not show documentation of updated medical
passport after 1/24/2023 showing the child’s current medical exams
documented.
Repeat Violation cited during the 2022 Interim inspection, with a CAP
approved on 11/9/2022; and the 2021 Renewal inspection, with a CAP
approved on 10/19/2021.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Nothing this inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:

• Nothing this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one corrective action plan this reporting period. The
corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2022 Interim Inspection where it
received the following rule violations:
• R400.12212(3)(a) Personnel records.
• R400.12419(1) (c) &(h) Initial service plans.
• ISEP 6.33(5) (c) Assessments and Service Plans, Content (Commitment
69).
• FOM 722-6B Family Team Meeting.
• FOM 722-8 Case Service Plans-Overview, Types, and Timeframes.
• FOM 722-8 D Treatment plans- Agreement and signature.
• FOM 722-8E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary- Completion
Requirements.
• FOM 722-15 Discharge Documents.
• FOM 801-3 Medical Passports.
• FOM 802-2 Mental and Behavioral Health.
As it relates to the agency’s efforts to achieve this corrective action plan,
the agency provided documentation showing its use of a revised spreadsheets to
track performance evaluation, completed trainings denoted in this corrective action
plan; samples of monthly data meetings where supervisors discussed key
performance indicators, samples of monthly and weekly supervisor/ worker
meetings showing discussion with workers on items such as service plan due
dates, FTMs, medical and dental exams, treatment plans and required signatures,
medical passports, training related to the agency’s licensing audit, and MISACWIS
uploads. Sample email reminders to staff on task due dates and a copy of the
case upload checklist (with a number of the latter observed during my records
review) were also provided.
The agency efforts to complete this corrective action resulted in some progress on
the corrective action plan, but the agency was not totally successful with all, as
indicated by the repeat violations indicated in this report.
Chief Administrator Assessment

The agency completed a 2023 annual administrator's report. No concerns were
observed.
Financial Overview
This is not applicable; this is a state agency.
Staff and Youth Interviews
In addition to engaging with the chief administrator, the section manager, and two
supervisors during the entrance conference, three foster care workers and one
supervisor was interviewed. The staff reported positive remarks related to the
agency, such as the team work that occurs, resources for children and families,
support from coworkers, supervisors and managers; and the new district manager
being open-minded and helpful. Areas of concern centered on the abundance of
paperwork, and a need/desire for additional staff.
No youths were interviewed. The agency does not have independent living youths.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A tour of the agency was completed, and no areas of concern or safety issues
were observed.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
October 25, 2023
_____________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 26, 2023
_____________________________________
Rorie Dodge-Pifer Date
Area Manager
